 1.3 - ADAPTABLE
IDENTIFY INPUT PURPOSE(LEVEL AA)
On accessible websites...

The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be
programmatically determined when:

 * The input field serves a purpose identified in the Input Purposes for User
   Interface Components section; and
 * The content is implemented using technologies with support for identifying
   the expected meaning for form input data.

These websites...

Create content that can be presented in different ways (for example simpler
layout) without losing information or structure.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
A contact form using icons
A browser plugin to add icons inserts icons representing the person's name, home
address, telephone number and email address to identify the input purpose
visually. I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/identify-input-purpose.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
